summary: The Democracy in Design Act aims to ensure that the design of public buildings in the United States adheres to established guiding principles for Federal architecture. It directs the Administrator of General Services to enforce these principles, referencing a 1962 report on Federal architecture. Furthermore, the bill mandates the Administrator to issue regulations, within 180 days of enactment, implementing the architectural principles and establishing minimum design standards for public buildings, with public notice and comment required.
